news_header: A Turkish Airlines pilot died mid-flight from Seattle to Istanbul after collapsing in the cockpit.
news_text: Captain Ilcehin Pehlivan, a 59-year-old pilot for Turkish Airlines, collapsed during flight TK204 from Seattle to Istanbul. Despite efforts to provide first aid, he died before the plane could make an emergency landing in New York. The second pilot and co-pilot took over controls after Pehlivan fell ill over Canadian territory. He had been with the airline since 2007 and had passed a health check in March. The cause of death has not been disclosed, and Turkey's air traffic controllers' association expressed condolences.
